text: [Music]
hi everyone and welcome to today's video
session my name is thomas and i'm one of
the ielts teachers here at lango
learning system
our online videos are designed to help
you improve a certain aspect of one of
the four key competencies for your ielts
exam in this case speaking
today i'm going to give you guys 10
idioms which you can use when talking
about money which you can employ to vary
your expressions and vocabulary in your
ielts speaking exam which will hopefully
increase both your range and your
fluency
for each one i will show you the
definition and then an example for you
to understand remember to take notes if
there's anything that's unfamiliar to
you if you're ready then let's begin
number one is to cost an arm and a leg
this is to be very expensive i wanted to
buy a new laptop but it'll cost me an
arm and a leg number two is daylight
robbery a situation in which you're
asked to pay too much money for
something for example the seller said i
had to pay 300 000 vietnam dong for a
box of facial masks that is just
daylight robbery
number three is to feel the pinch this
is to have problems with money because
the things that you need are too
expensive or your income has been
reduced an example would be due to the
negative impacts of the kovid 19
pandemic on the economy i lost my job
and i've really started to feel the
pinch number four is down the drain to
lose or waste a lot of money
i prefer to buy high quality things that
i know i will definitely need i won't be
buying any more low quality items that's
just throwing money down the drain
number five money talks we say this
about people or organizations that are
rich and can therefore get or do what
they want i suppose money talks and in
this case it talks so effectively that
the company quickly bought off many
positions in the state-owned enterprise
number six is to foot the bill to pay
for something especially something
expensive for example
i desperately needed new trainers and
saw a beautiful pair of black ones in
the shopping center however i can't foot
the bill for them right now i'm skinned
number seven is bread or butter a job or
activity that provides you with the main
part of the income you need to live
for example the fantastic handsome
wonderful teacher i know doesn't make
much money from editing and recording
classroom teaching is his bread and
butter number eight is to go broke to
spend or to lose all of your money
he went broke after his company went
bankrupt i really hope that you found
this session helpful in preparing you
for your ielts speaking test if you want
to sign up for ielts courses here at
lango please click on the link below
our ielts courses are designed to cater
to your individual needs and to provide
you with personalized learning pathways
remember to like and subscribe and
please don't forget to hit that bell
button to get notifications of all our
latest videos
i've been thomas from lango learning
system and hopefully i'll see you next
time bye
